text: hi everyone today recipe is very healthy
and refreshing summer drink from a very
beautiful fruit is a dragon fruit shake
or Shinto done long let's begin
dragon fruit has a leathery dark pink
skin is part of the cactus family the
inside flash is sweet and chilling with
thousands of black sea slices and misses
to prepare the fruit cut in half
lengthwise and then in half again then
peel off the skin because it's not
edible and then chop into smaller pieces
so it's easier to process
dragon fruit goes well with bananas and
berries so you can also consider adding
those fruit to your drink in a blender
adding the flesh of one dragon fruit one
cup of crushed ice 2 to 3 tbsp of
sweetened condensed milk you can add in
more or less condensed milk depending on
how sweet your dragon fruit is and also
your taste of course also add 1/3 cup of
milk so your blender can have some
liquid to work with cover and blend well
that's it
just pour into your glass garnish with a
lime wheel and enjoy dragon fruit is
high in antioxidants vitamins fiber and
calcium so it's really good for you I
really hope you enjoy this recipe
because I had a really hard time looking
for a dragon fruit in my city I'm not
sure how I came up with the idea to put
dragon fruit shake in the list of three
choices for you guys to vote last week
because honestly I have never bought a
dragon fruit in Germany and to my
surprise everybody voted for a dragon
fruit shake which means I have to buy it
by any means and you know how much they
cost 14 euros for just add 2 dragon
fruits that I had in the video crazy
writes that should cut just around 1
euros in Vietnam
but because it's an exotic fruit and
they have to can carry it here so it's
cause really a lot more anyway in
Germany I got the chance to hang big
cherry which is a dream for many friends
in Vietnam and for one kilogram of cell
pick cherries I only paid 3 euros 50
cents
whereas in Vietnam they may cost five
times more well that's a lot about
pricing anyway I just want to share with
you some of the nice clips from my
cherry picking experience yesterday if
you have any good recipe with cherry
please let me know because I really have
picked a lot of cherries thank you for
watching bye
you
